intro: Psychotria densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale green flowers, which are often surrounded by velvety, hairy foliage. It typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, shaded forest environments. Psychotria densiflora is also noted for its chemical composition, which includes various alkaloids and has been studied for potential medicinal properties.
